pros: Good state benefits Tuition assistance

pros: Students are the most redeeming part

pros: Great for people who can't handle micro management.
cons: Exploited student workers to do work they could not afford to heir professional adults to do. All staff were over worked and under-paid. Most people held or work several different jobs without any additional pay.

review_title: Stay for 1-3 years for experience and find something better

pros: Enjoyed working with students Made a few great friends among staff I was able to keep my skillset sharp

pros: Friendly Environment Family Feel Long Term

pros: Ten years ago, it was a nice place to work--thriving. The students are the only good part.

pros: Life would be relatively easy if you'll willing to bear unfairness.

review_title: HBCU with plenty of campus pride
job_title: Provost and Vice President for Academic Affairs in Savannah, GA
pros: student centered, dedicated staff, beautiful location, engaged students, strong community
cons: high crime rate, too much control from the University System of Georgia, high debt and declining enrollments, low salaries and morale

pros: Most of the faculty and staff are great people.  Technology dept does a wonderful job of keeping everything updated.  Beautiful campus.  After working here for over ten years, I've built some lifelong relationships.
cons: Too many political games.  Hard to trust anyone due to the lying and backstabbing.  President and her cabinet doesn't appear to know what they're doing. Most on campus are Afraid of her because she's a dictator.  Campus is nothing like it used to be--family oriented and enjoyable.  Quality of students is questionable. It seems to be all about quantity.  Not sure where we are headed.  Athletics dept and the AD are a total mess. he is clueless but is allowed to do whatever he wants to because the prez backs him. Morale at an all time low.  Many are job hunting.

pros: The experience is nice and fair
cons: Better pay should be apart of jt

pros: For student workers, supervisors are very supportive and understanding of your class schedule and are willing to work with it as long as you are willing to make sure your job is getting accomplished while your there.Also allows you to work on school related work as long as job is done for today and things are not to busy in the office or students don't need tutoring or whatever it might be as student worker.
cons: Really no cons as long as you make sure your tasks for that day get done as you should be making sure of.Depending the department  you  work for you might be doing a lot of walking on campus

pros: HBCU university located in a beautiful city. It has access to HBCU-directed government funding for equipment and small research projects as well as educational grants from the NIH, the NSF and the DoD
cons: The university is being mismanaged by an unqualified president who was appointed without vetting. As a result she is extremely paranoid of qualified faculty. She immediately silences any critic. Her policies are anti-excellence and anti-academic.  She has assembled a bunch of cronies who are even less qualified than she is. The result is constant financial crisis, lack of security, attrition and diminished enrollment. She created an environment of fear and retaliation. The Alumni and faculty have written letters detailing her failures and calling for her removal. These letters were discussed on TV and can be found online

pros:
I love this school. I was successful as a post graduate student. My professors where challenging. 
I have worked as a worked as a work study. The time I worked with Dr. Otis Johnson was priceless.
I live within  a 30 min. walk of the campus.
cons: Leadeship at his school is great. Work environment very professional.

job_title: Front Desk Clerk in Savannah, GA
pros: Everyone at the university becomes family after working there for a few months.
cons: The systems are not updated. I do not believe they've ever been updated. It is extremely frustrating to want to improve how things are done on the daily to be more effective but you do not have the support of management and administration.

review_title: Your experience will depend on who you know
pros: Great retirement, health benefits, and vacation/sick/holidays. Most people are great to work with.
cons: Growth and advancement depends on who you know.

pros: Family enivironment, and friendly employees.  The health benefits are great as well the tuition assistance program.  You are able to achieve most any degree.
cons: Over the past 6 years there have been budget cuts and fuloughs.  The cost of living continues to go up, but it not easy to supplement the rising costs.  The university worked hard so that no employee would have to be terminated.

pros: Paid vacation, medical insurance, dental insurance, retirement pay, life insurance, professional devwlopment workshops, family like work environment, efficient balance of work life and family life,
cons: Short breaks during peak periods, lack of opportunities for advancement, low salary for amount of work performed

pros: They will pay for 3 classes a semester for you to get an education at one of the schools within the University System of Georgia.
cons: If you are not apart of the right "click" or "social group" you will not get ahead or compensated fairly.

pros: Great place to work. Staff members are easy to get along with. Benefits are great. Great place to begin your career. Attain skills that you can use in other industries.
cons: Things are not organized to make work easy. Usually have to jump through hoops to get things accomplished.

pros: Education Assistance Program regulated by the State of Georgia.
cons: Terrible institution. No organization. Everything is always late or behind. If your not buddy buddy with someone of status then don't ever expect to get a promotion or be able to move to another department without backlash.

review_title: Needs to be merged with another Georgia state university
pros: Salary is decent, campus is pretty, it's close to downtown Savannah which is lovely and historic.
cons: Faculty engage in petty personal politics, management is vindictive to those who question its practices, students are HORRIBLY underqualified. It is essentially an open admissions institution, but without the infrastructure to support such an admissions policy.

pros: Located in Savannah which is beautiful.  Beautiful campus.
cons: The school has a great tendency to hire their own graduates.  Crabs in a barrel mentality among co-workers.

pros: Great college higher education environment & opportunity to learn from and educate bright students.
cons: Many employees are not open to change and innovation.

review_title: Great Students, management not so much
pros: beautiful campus, great student body, dedicated faculty
cons: poor management and oversight, resistant to fresh ideas and innovative approaches

pros: The atmosphere and the ambition and drive of my coworkers was always amazing to see.
cons: Sometimes people try and give the run around instead of a direct answer.
